description: One-minute skill: Small Multiples: Repeat to Reveal.

hook.text: How do you show 50 countries' GDP trends in one view without spaghetti lines tangling together?

buildup.text: Small multiples repeat the same chart for each subset â€” one tiny chart per country, aligned in a grid.

discovery.text: The eye can instantly compare patterns across dozens of panels because the format stays consistent.

twist.text: Edward Tufte championed small multiples, calling them 'the best design solution for a wide range of problems.'

climax.text: They work because they exploit our ability to compare shapes â€” not read individual data points.

punchline.text: Repeat the frame. Let the data tell each story.
